title: Neonatal Resuscitation Simulation Training Program: Enhancing Communication and Documentation Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Theoretical knowledge and clinical experience in Neonatal Life Support (NLS), proficiency in using medical terminology and writing reports in healthcare settings
context.additional_context: Simulation-based training for practicing medical professionals to strengthen practical competencies. Emphasis is placed on accurate medical terminology usage and report-writing skills during data recording and analysis processes using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: In neonatal resuscitation simulation scenarios, learners perform standard protocols (initial assessment, airway maintenance, breathing support) with 90% accuracy and provide clear verbal instructions and feedback within the team.
In team-based emergency situations, learners improve communication efficiency to reduce decision-making time by 30% and clearly document role allocation.

Learners describe in a 3-page self-assessment report how their responsibility and emotional regulation abilities affected two real-life resuscitation cases and write a structured report meeting at least four of five evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
